intro: Gilia ochroleuca subsp. exilis, commonly known as the slender gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies exilis is distinguished by its shorter stature and more compact growth compared to other subspecies of Gilia ochroleuca.
